      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,

        Initializes the AllParts Table. The Second table is purposely excluded.

      • returnToMainMenu

        public void returnToMainMenu​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Made this to make returning to the main menu more readable.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • passSelectedProduct

        public void passSelectedProduct​(Product prod)
        Initializes the second table to display the associated parts by using the values of the provided product object. In addition, the text fields are filled with the values of the parameter's variables.
        Parameters:
        prod - - the product that is being passed from the MainForm controller.

      • onModProductSaveButtonAction

        public void onModProductSaveButtonAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        First assigns interval values based on the inputted text in text fields. If there are any type mismatches here from invalid input, the catch block will display an error message. A logic check ensures that the minimum is less than the maximum. If everything checks out, the variables are assigned to their respective values within the private currentProduct object and the updateProduct method is used to change the item contained at the given index. The user is then returned to the main menu upon a successful save.
        Parameters:
        event - - click on Save button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onModProductSearchBarAction

        public void onModProductSearchBarAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        First any selected items on the table are unselected. The searchterm is grabbed from the search bar and a List containing the results of lookUpPart(searchTerm) is created. If the above List is empty, then an idSearch is performed where the result is highlighted. If the search still returns an empty list then an error message is shown to alert the user that the item was not found. Otherwise, the List containing the results of lookUpPart(searchTerm) is set to the tableView.
        Parameters:
        event - - text being entered into the search form.

      • onModProductAddButtonAction

        public void onModProductAddButtonAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method grabs the selected item from the table and adds it to the product's associated parts list using the addAssociatedParts() method.
        Parameters:
        event - - click on the Add button

      • onModProductRemoveButtonAction

        public void onModProductRemoveButtonAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        First, the selected item is grabbed, then an alert is shown to the user in order to confirm the removal of the selected part from the Product's associatedParts list. if the user clicks okay, then the selected product is deleted from the associatedParts list.
        Parameters:
        event - - click on the remove button

      • onModifyPartCancelAction

        public void onModifyPartCancelAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the user to the main menu using returnToMainMenu().
        Parameters:
        event - - click on the cancel button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
